DataElement.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events Motor Neuron Disorder Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the motor neuron disorder common toxicity criteria adverse event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Common Toxicity Criteria for Adverse Events Motor Neuron Disorder
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event._An efferent neuron that sends impulses from the central nervous system to skeletal muscles._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events

Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.longName: Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
Concepts.definition: A standard terminology developed to report adverse events occurring in cancer clinical trials.  Common terminology criteria for adverse events (CTCAE) are used in study adverse event summaries and Investigational New Drug reports to the Food and Drug Administration.  The CTCAE contain a grading scale for each adverse event term representing the severity of the event.

Concepts.definition: An efferent neuron that sends impulses from the central nervous system to skeletal muscles.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An efferent neuron that sends impulses from the central nervous system to skeletal muscles._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by the body's immune system attacking the peripheral nervous system causing ascending paralysis.

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by the body's immune system attacking the peripheral nervous system causing ascending paralysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A slight paralysis or weakness of both legs.

Concepts.definition: A slight paralysis or weakness of both legs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Weakness or incomplete paralysis of either the left or right side of the body.

Concepts.definition: Weakness or incomplete paralysis of either the left or right side of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An inflammatory process affecting the spinal cord. Causes include viral infections, autoimmune disorders, vascular disorders, and toxic agents. Symptoms include weakness, paresthesia, sensory loss, pain, and incontinence.

Concepts.definition: An inflammatory process affecting the spinal cord. Causes include viral infections, autoimmune disorders, vascular disorders, and toxic agents. Symptoms include weakness, paresthesia, sensory loss, pain, and incontinence.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A reduction in the strength of the facial muscles.: An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.: Partial or complete loss of function of one or more muscles. It is usually caused by damage to the nervous system.

Concepts.definition: A reduction in the strength of the facial muscles.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
Partial or complete loss of function of one or more muscles. It is usually caused by damage to the nervous system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Injury to any of the cranial nerves or their nuclei in the brain resulting in muscle weakness.

Concepts.definition: Injury to any of the cranial nerves or their nuclei in the brain resulting in muscle weakness.
